Body: Description: We recently implemented a security tool that shows our endpoint protector EC2 instance has several critical vulnerabilities associated with it, but I can't SSH into it to update and the web server isn't giving me any updates to run. I'd love some help getting this thing up to date!

What We've Learned Updated: 2/27/205
- Customer recently used a security tool and found several vulnerabilities associated with EPP
- Sent customer email requesting confirmation of EPP version 5.9.4.0

Next Steps Updated: Awaiting customer response from email
If customer still at EPP 5.9.4.0, will request customer create a snapshot of the current EPP server
- Schedule a remote session with the customer to upgrade the server to EPP5941
- Have customer rerun the scan to see if these vulnerabilities associated with EPP return
- Escalate issue to devops after attempting the upgrade to resolve issue

Next Steps Updated: Awaiting Meeting, to gather more details towards possible escalation on March 5, 2025 at 1300 CST

- Have customer rerun the scan to see if these vulnerabilities associated with EPP return
- Escalate issue to devops after attempting the upgrade to resolve issue

What We've Learned Updated: 3/5/2025
Hosted in Customer AWS

- Joined remote session

- EPP Version is at 5.9.4.1

- ssh problems? they have to open the port 62828 in order to ssh on it

- Added screen shot to attachments of security scan results

- php version can not be updated. Current PHP version 5.2.17. Linux Ubuntu 18.04.6.

- Customer could migrate server to a newer version.

* Created an ADO asking the engineers on status of the php upgrade process. Ticket Number # 00437858

2/27/205
- Customer recently used a security tool and found several vulnerabilities associated with EPP
- Sent customer email requesting confirmation of EPP version 5.9.4.0

What We've Learned Updated: 3/13/2025
- Customer is wanting to know what it would take to migrate to ubuntu 22
- Working on steps to send to customer that is hosting EPP server on AWS
- Sending response email once steps are created and speaking with team on next steps
